val: A small, soft black or dark purple fruit
engSentences: She was very beautiful, and her lipstick was the color of a blackberry bruise.

val: An insect with large colourful wings and a thin body
engSentences: There is nothing in a caterpillar that tells you it's going to be a butterfly.
Float like a butterfly, sting like a bee. Muhammad Ali

val: To remain firm under suffering or misfortune without yielding
To continue to exist without any loss in quality or importance
engSentences: We live in our fantasies and endure our realities.
It is easier to find men who will volunteer to die, than to find those who are willing to endure pain with patience.

val: An extremely large group of stars and planets that extends over many billions of light years.
Any of the very large groups of stars and associated matter that are found throughout the universe
engSentences: Our galaxy, the Milky Way, is one of 50 or 100 billion other galaxies in the universe.

val: A piece of land that is completely surrounded by water.
engSentences: There is more treasure in books than in all the pirate's loot on Treasure Island. Walt Disney
We live on an island surrounded by a sea of ignorance. As our island of knowledge grows, so does the shore of our ignorance.

val: The quality of being gentle, caring, and helpful
engSentences: Kindness is the language which the deaf can hear and the blind can see. Mark Twain
A warm smile is the universal language of kindness.

val: A large wild member of the cat family that is found in Africa.
engSentences: I am not afraid of an army of lions led by a sheep; I am afraid of an army of sheep led by a lion. Alexander the Great
A lion is called a 'king of beasts' obviously for a reason.

val: A piece of music written to be played by an orchestra
engSentences: You can't play a symphony alone, it takes an orchestra to play it.
I'm like any other composer. If you give me five years to write a symphony, I'm still going to be asking for more time two days before it's due.

val: The whole of space and all the stars, planets, and other forms of matter and energy in it
engSentences: Early astronomers thought that our planet was the centre of the universe.
You, yourself, as much as anybody in the entire universe, deserve your love and affection. Buddha

val: Very large mammals that live in the sea
engSentences: A life-size installation of a giant blue whale has been erected on the Left Bank of the Seine, intended as a reminder to negotiators at the international climate conference here that the fate of threatened species is also in their hands
